page.title: 05 NEWTON KYME VILLAGE
page.content:
Newton Kyme is a tranquil country village nestling among the wooded parkland. The houses are grouped in clusters. All the houses are stone built, the newer ones being blended in with the old. Many of the houses are detached and have an old world charm with their ivy, wisteria and creeper clad walls.
Newton Kyme is an historic village. In Norman times there was a castle and Manor House and today there are just the remains of a moat. The church is tucked away behind Newton Kyme Hall (where they hold functions and other private meetings). Inside their are well preserved wooden carvings.
